GlooKit.Utils

Class JSONObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • GlooKit.Utils.JSONObject

  • public class JSONObject
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a JSONObject as a map of keys and values. Keys will always be Strings, while values will can be Strings, String arrays, JSONObjects, or JSONObject arrays.

    Several convenience methods are provided to retrieve a value of a given type from the JSONObject. Methods are also provided to read in key-value pairs from a .json file and write JSONObjects to file. In addition, one can specify whether the JSONObject should be written to file in a way that is human-readable or compact through the inline boolean.

    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    JSONable

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public JSONObject add(java.lang.String key,
                      java.lang.Object value)
        Adds a key-value pair to this JSONObject. Values that are not Strings or JSONObjects (or arrays) are interpreted as Strings.
        Parameters:
        key - String for the name of the field to be added to this JSONObject
        value - Object for the value of the field to be added to this JSONObject. Must be a String, String[], JSONObject, JSONObject[], or something with a toString() method.
        Returns:
        this JSONObject itself. This allows for multiple .add calls to be strung together

      • add

        private JSONObject add(java.lang.String key,
                       java.lang.Object value,
                       boolean alreadyParsed)
        Actually adds a key-value pair to this JSONObject, given the key-value pair and a boolean for whether we have already parsed the strings. alreadyParsed should be set to true if this key-value pair has already been read from file and set to false if a user is adding a new key-value pair from inside the program. Parsing, in this case, refers to the process of re-escaping characters that need to remain escaped within the string.
        Parameters:
        key - String for the name of the field to be added to this JSONObject
        value - Object for the value of the field to be added to this JSONObject. Must be a String, String[], JSONObject, JSONObject[], or something with a toString() method.
        alreadyParsed - Boolean for whether this key-value pair has already been read from file
        Returns:
        this JSONObject itself. This allows for multiple .add calls to be strung together

      • fetch

        private java.lang.Object fetch(java.lang.String... keys)
        Retrieves a value (or multiple values) of this JSONObject or its child objects given an array of strings (a var arg of strings). If one of the values along the path of keys is actually a JSONObject[], data lensing is performed. That is, all of the corresponding values of all of the child objects are returned in an array.
        Parameters:
        keys - A variable number of strings of the keys for the value to be retrieved
        Returns:
        the value (or values) corresponding to the key list given

      • fetchBoolean

        public boolean fetchBoolean(java.lang.String... keys)
        Overloads the fetchBoolean(boolean, String...) method to assume a default value of false.
        Parameters:
        keys - A variable number of strings of the keys for the value to be retrieved
        Returns:
        the boolean value corresponding to the key list given, defaulting to false

      • fetchBoolean

        public boolean fetchBoolean(boolean defaultValue,
                            java.lang.String... keys)
        Retrieves a boolean value of this JSONObject. Defaults to defaultValue given if no value can be parsed.
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - a boolean for the value to be returned if no value can be parsed from the JSONObject
        keys - A variable number of strings of the keys for the value to be retrieved
        Returns:
        the boolean value corresponding to the key list given, defaulting to defaultValue

      • fetchBooleans

        public boolean[] fetchBooleans(java.lang.String... keys)
        Retrieves a boolean array of values of this JSONObject. If the list of values cannot be parsed, it returns a new boolean[].
        Parameters:
        keys - A variable number of strings of the keys for the values to be retrieved
        Returns:
        a boolean array of values corresponding to the key list given, defaulting to a new boolean[] if the entire list could not be parsed

      • fetchDouble

        public java.lang.Double fetchDouble(java.lang.String... keys)
        Retrieves a Double value of this JSONObject. Any value not parsed defaults to null.
        Parameters:
        keys - A variable number of strings of the keys for the value to be retrieved
        Returns:
        a Double of the value corresponding to the key list given, defaulting to null

      • fetchDouble

        public double fetchDouble(double defaultValue,
                          java.lang.String... keys)
        Retrieves a primitive-safe double value of this JSONObject. Any value not parsed defaults to defaultValue
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - a double for the value to be returned if no value can be parsed from the JSONObject
        keys - A variable number of strings of the keys for the value to be retrieved
        Returns:
        a primitive-safe double of the value corresponding to the key list given, defaulting to defaultValue

      • fetchDoubles

        public java.lang.Double[] fetchDoubles(java.lang.String... keys)
        Retrieves a Double array of values of this JSONObject. If the list of values cannot be parsed, it returns a new Double[]. Individual elements that cannot be parsed default to null.
        Parameters:
        keys - A variable number of strings of the keys for the value to be retrieved
        Returns:
        a Double array of values corresponding to the key list given, defaulting to a new Double[] if the entire list could not be parsed

      • fetchInteger

        Retrieves an Integer value of this JSONObject. Any value not parsed defaults to null.
        Parameters:
        keys - A variable number of strings of the keys for the value to be retrieved
        Returns:
        an Integer of the value corresponding to the key list given, defaulting to null

      • fetchInt

        public java.lang.Integer fetchInt(int defaultValue,
                                  java.lang.String... keys)
        Retrieves a primitive-safe int of this JSONObject. Any value not parsed defaults to defaultValue.
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - an int for the value to be returned if no value can be parsed from the JSONObject
        keys - A variable number of strings of the keys for the value to be retrieved
        Returns:
        a primitive-safe int of the value corresponding to the key list given, defaulting to defaultValue

      • fetchIntegers

        public java.lang.Integer[] fetchIntegers(java.lang.String... keys)

        Parameters:
        keys - A variable number of strings of the keys for the value to be retrieved
        Returns:
        an Integer array of values corresponding to the key list given, defaulting to a new Integer[] if the entire list could not be parsed

      • fetchJSONObject

        public JSONObject fetchJSONObject(java.lang.String... keys)
        Retrieves a JSONObject value of this JSONObject. If the value could not be parsed, it defaults to null.
        Parameters:
        keys - A variable number of strings of the keys for the value to be retrieved
        Returns:
        a JSONObject corresponding to the key list given, defaulting to null

      • fetchJSONObjects

        public JSONObject[] fetchJSONObjects(java.lang.String... keys)
        Retrieves an array of JSONObject values of this JSONObject. If the list of values cannot be parsed, it returns a new JSONObject[]. Individual elements that cannot be parsed default to null.
        Parameters:
        keys - A variable number of strings of the keys for the value to be retrieved
        Returns:
        a JSONObject array of values corresponding to the key list given, defaulting to a new JSONObject[] if the entire list could not be parsed

      • fetchString

        public java.lang.String fetchString(java.lang.String... keys)

        Parameters:
        keys - A variable number of strings of the keys for the value to be retrieved
        Returns:
        a String corresponding to the key list given, defaulting to null

      • fetchStrings

        Parameters:
        keys - A variable number of strings of the keys for the value to be retrieved
        Returns:
        a String array of values corresponding to the key list given, defaulting to a new String[] if the entire list could not be parsed

        Parameters:

        Parses a string for the key of a value to add to this JSONObject based on a char array.
        Parameters:
        chars - a char array containing a key
        Returns:
        a String for the key of the value to be added

        Parses a single value to add to this JSONObject based on a char array.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Either a String, String[], JSONObject, or JSONObject[]

      • readFromFile

        public void readFromFile(java.lang.String filepath)
        Adds key-value pairs to this JSONObject based on a .json file.
        Parameters:
        filepath - a String of the filepath of the .json file whose key-value pairs are to be loaded in

      • reescapeString

        private java.lang.String reescapeString(java.lang.String string)
        Takes a String and preemptively escapes all special characters that will get interpreted when the String is constructed. This preserves them in their raw form.
        Parameters:
        string - String whose special characters will be escaped
        Returns:
        Same String with all special characters escaped

      • setInline

        public void setInline(boolean inline)
        Sets whether this JSONObject should print itself out on one line.
        Parameters:
        inline - Boolean for whether this JSONObject should print out inline (true means inline)

      • tabber

        private java.lang.String tabber(int numTabs)
        Returns a String of numTabs tabs. If a non-positive number is given, returns the empty string.
        Parameters:
        numTabs - int number of tabs to be in String
        Returns:
        String containing numTabs tabs

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overloads the standard toString() method to call our special toString(int) method with a depth of 0.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String of this JSONObject

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(int depth)
        Overloads the toString(int, boolean) method to use the inline boolean of this JSONObject.
        Parameters:
        depth - int for the number of tabs to prefix to every line (if not inline)
        Returns:
        String of this JSONObject

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(int depth,
                                 boolean inline)
        Returns a String representation of this JSONObject. If inline is true, then the String will be as compact as possible. If inline is false, then the String will be human-readable with at least depth tabs prefixed to every line.
        Parameters:
        depth - int for the number of tabs to prefix to every line (if not inline)
        inline - boolean for whether the String should be as compact as possible
        Returns:
        String of this JSONObject

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(boolean inline)
        Overloads the toString(int, boolean) method with a depth of 0.
        Parameters:
        inline - boolean for whether the String should be as compact as possible
        Returns:
        String of this JSONObject

      • writeToFile

        public boolean writeToFile(java.lang.String filepath)
        Writes a copy of this JSONObject to the .json filepath given.
        Parameters:
        filepath - String for the filepath of the .json file to be saved to
        Returns:
        boolean for whether this JSONObject was successfully written to file
